title: Stories from Our Ancestors
storyDescription: A child learns about the homes and lives of their ancestors through family stories

mixedSegments.text: Little Aisha sat with her grandmother. 'Tell me about ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ (the former people),' she asked.
Grandmother smiled. 'Our بَنِىٓ (Children) of old lived simply, yet their بُيُوتِ (houses) were full of love.'
'Their ٱلْبَيْتِ (the House) was not just walls,' she continued. 'It was a مَـَٔابٍ (place of return) for the whole family.'
Aisha imagined those old homes. 'ٱلسَّمَآءُ (the heavens) was their roof, and the earth was their floor.'
'Yes,' grandmother nodded. 'They built صِرَٰطٍ (a path) between their homes so neighbors could visit easily.'
Aisha hugged her grandmother. She was grateful for the stories of those ancient بُيُوتِ (houses) that came before.

title: The Wisdom of Building
storyDescription: A story about using wisdom and reason when building a home

mixedSegments.text: The wise builder addressed the villagers. 'When you build بُيُوتِكُمْ (your houses), you must تَعْقِلُونَ (use reason).''
A young man asked, 'What makes a strong ٱلْبَيْتِ (the House)?' The builder pointed to the ground.
'First, choose a good مَكَانًا (a place). Build on solid ٱلْبَرِّ (the land), not on shifting sand.'
'Look up at وَٱلسَّمَآءِ (By the heaven) for guidance,' he said. 'Let light enter your بُيُوتِكُمْ (your houses).'
'Make your home a ٱلْمِهَادُ ([the] resting-place) of peace,' he continued. 'Let it be a مَـَٔابٍ (place of return) for your heart.'
The villagers nodded wisely. They understood that building with reason creates homes that last forever.

title: Many Homes, One Community
storyDescription: A story about a community with many people and their diverse houses

mixedSegments.text: In the ٱلْمَدِينَةِ (the city), there lived كَثِيرًا (many) ٱلنَّاسُ (the people). Each had their own home.
One قَوْمٌ (a people) built small بُيُوتِ (houses) close together. They loved being neighbors.
Another قَوْمٍ (a people) lived in larger homes with جَنَّٰتٍ (Gardens) around them.
The prophet of قَوْمِهِۦ (his people) walked among the ٱلنَّاسَ ([the] people). He taught them about unity.
'All these بُيُوتِ (houses) are gifts,' he said. 'Build them لِلنَّاسِ (to [the] people) with kindness in your hearts.'
The people understood. Whether homes were small or grand, what mattered most was the love shared فِيهَا (therein).
